One of the coolest parts, and something I wish you'd asked him, is why are the older magma plume islands so much smaller than the younger ones?

The answer is that the old ones were once just as big as the Big Island, but they've been eroded away over millions of years! Eventually, the Big Island will slowly erode into the sea. Other islands appearing in the east, each larger and younger than the preceding ones west of them, will continue to form over the mantle plume. One day, the Big Island will be an underwater shallow reef somewhere west of the new, future Hawaii islands that have yet to be formed. Even the Mauna Kea volcano, currently at over 2 miles (4.2km) above sea level, will erode until the waves overtake it and it's the last little dot in the chain of new Hawaiian islands.

When North Korea tested their last Hydrogen Bomb (in 2017) under a mountain, the explosion, like an asteroid impact, sent shock waves around the earth. (It also destroyed the mountain.) Seconds later, Yellowstone started rumbling and having earthquakes. The earthquakes were recorded on earthquake.usgs.gov. Those shock waves really can do damage.

Scientists think that the Hawaiian Hot Spot was caused by an asteroid impact, either Chicxulub (100 mile wide) or the Shiva crater near Mumbai (300 mile wide), both impacts around 65 million years ago when the islands started.  When an asteroid hits the earth, the shock waves race around the earth and blow out the other side where they meet (the antipode).  It is thought that the Chicxulub impact in the Yucatan blew out the Deccan Flats in India (the Reunion Hot Spot) which magnetism and lava attracted the Shiva asteroid soon after.  That asteroid smashed open the Reunion Magma Chamber, leaving a teardrop crater and massive volcanism.    The asteroid hit the earth so hard it broke the plate, separating India from the Seychelles Islands and shoving India at high speed up into China.  The crater today is partly on the plate with the Seychelles but mostly on the Indian plate off the coast of Mumbai.  Oil companies have drilled there for decades. Other hot spots such as Yellowstone and the Siberian Traps are thought to have been created by asteroid impacts, as well.

Informative as always.  However (of course) I think they got the part about the magma flows millions of years ago being "explosive".  As I understand it they where not explosive.  These great magma flows that lasted for centuries generally took place in the middle of the tectonic plates and did not contain any water so they simply flowed out in giant sheets.  Only volcanoes along the edge of the tectonic plates explode because they have super heated water in them that explodes when released from the high pressures in the magma flow.  This is why the volcanoes of Hawaii only emerge into a pool and flow out down the slopes.  Volcanoes such as Mt. Saint Helen are caused by the clashing of tectonic plates which also pumps water into the magma chamber.  All volcanoes along these faults are explosive and all the ones in the interior of the plates are not.

One hypothesis for the weird bend in the island chain (which can also be seen on other similar island chains in the Pacific ocean) is that when the India collided with Asia 55-50 million years ago, it created so much force that it knocked the Pacific plate onto a different trajectory.


I decided to double check that the timelines match up, and they do! Based on the Pacific plate moving ~7 cm/yr (google) and the bend being ~3600 km away from Hawaii (google earth), that means the bend was formed ~51 million years ago, right around the same time.

Origin of life "science" is actually a pseudoscience that denies real chemistry. Change my mind (or refute me If you can). The "chemical evolution" hypothesis of Oparin doesn't make any chemical sense. The first living cell, with a minimum of 256 protein-coding genes, ATP production capacity, filled with complex molecular machinery, and self-replicating, could not have formed spontaneously according to our current knowledge. For life 4 classes of compounds are needed: proteins, carbohydrates, lipids and nucleotides, we don't know how to synthesize any of those in prebiotic-like conditions. What we know is that in order to synthesize then, a series of intermediate steps are necessary, and that these intermediate products (and final products) are frequently unstable to air, light, water..., (the peptide bonds of proteins, for example, rapidly undergo hydrolysis in water), which means that time is a not a good argument in favor of abiogenesis, the whole process would have to occur very rapidly. Also, life compounds are homochiral, but random reactions produce racemic mixtures (for example, the aminoacids produced by Urey-Miller are racemic, while life's proteins are made (almost exclusevily) of l-aminoacids), and that is a huge problem in terms of chemical synthesis. Also, the proposed reactions for the prebiotic synthesis of nucleotides are thermodynamically unfavourable, meaning they do not occur spontaneously. And that is only the beginning of the problem, even If we had all the molecules, we have no idea how to build a cell. All the nanotechnology that we have developed so far looks like "childplay" in comparison with the "simplest" cell. In summary, from the point of view of the chemical sciences, origin of life remains a total mistery. https://youtu.be/zU7Lww-sBPg

NOAH must have been at Berkley when that University was still concerned with LEARNING, and not SOCIAL JUSTICE! But the Hawaiian Islands are by no means unique. In May of this year, my partner and I, along with two wonderful ladies, visited the French Indian Ocean island of LA REUNION (previously the Isle Bourbon), where the mighty shield volcano PITON DE LA FOURNAISE, dominates the southern third of the island; whilst the extinct PITON DES NEIGES towers over the northern section, rising to 10,070 ft; making it the highest point in the Indian Ocean. In many ways the island resembles a 'mini-Hawaii', because it is only 40 miles x 30 miles; and the scenery is spectacular. FOURNAISE is also over a hotspot (it was once beneath the Deccan Traps of western India, and then Mauritius), and is one of the most accessible volcanoes on Earth. You can drive to the very precipice surrounding L'Enclos, the vast caldera where today's active cones, Tory and Dolomieu hold sway. However, like Hawaii, FOURNAISE can surprise everyone, by 'splitting' along a fracture zone, and pouring out lava, in full view of those watching from the cliff-edge! Spectacular.

You could fit Tokyo, the world's biggest city, in Yellowstone's super-volcanic crater. Three super-eruptions at Yellowstone appear to have occurred on a 600,000-700,000 year cycle starting 2.1 million years ago. The most recent took place 640,000 years ago – suggesting Yellowstone is overdue for an eruption. There are about 20 known supervolcanoes on Earth - including Lake Toba in Indonesia, Lake Taupo in New Zealand, and the somewhat smaller Phlegraean Fields near Naples, Italy. Super-eruptions occur rarely - only once every 100,000 years on average. Given Yellowstone's past history, the yearly probability of another caldera-forming eruption can be approximated as 1 in 730,000 or 0.00014%. However, this number is based simply on averaging the two intervals between the three major past eruptions at Yellowstone — this is hardly enough to make a critical judgment. Yellowstone has had at least three such eruptions: The three eruptions, 2.1 million years ago, 1.2 million years ago and 640,000 years ago, were about 6,000, 700 and 2,500 times larger than the May 18, 1980 eruption of Mt. St. Helens in Washington State.

The same mantle plume created the islands, yes...But you’re misleading viewers by saying it’s one volcano; the term refers merely to a vent.

Your geologist buddy, while learned on flood basalts, didn’t exactly cover the “snapshot” metaphor ideally. They’re independent deposits; snapshots can be flipped back and forth, not topography. What we see at the surface today is more of a collage. Also Hawaii isn’t exactly a flood basalt environment, it’s a shield volcano that erupts very non-viscous lavas (compared to silicious melts) and produce the wide/shallow slope vents iconic in the area. Flood basalts flood, basalt flows flow. How do you flood if you’re in the ocean? It’s already flooded.

As the Pacific plate moves over the plume, new magma compositions are temporarily produced as the oceanic crust partially melts at depth and forms a calc-alkaline melt that behaves very differently than the basalt typically fed into the system by the plume. This makes newly forming volcanoes in the Hawaii region a bit more violent, but they’re usually built up from the sea floor where the underlying plume heats the preexisting crustal material. These would be even less flood-like, but I must admit I imagine the time it takes to melt the cold, wet oceanic crust may allow for the region to build pressure and further increase the melt material by pressure melting until it finally bursts. But those form pillow basalts —definitely worth a lookup if you want to see goopy looking rocks.

{B.S. Geology & Inorganic Chemistry}

The Hot Spot Theory is geological fiction. Here are some things to consider:
1) Even if a hot plume of magma could slowly rise through the entire mantle, the plume would lose heat to colder, overlying rock. This heat loss would exceed the excess heat in the plume. Calculations show that hot plumes cannot rise from the outer core and produce flood basalts. Nor will current processes open cracks in the mantle so a plume can rise.Confining pressures under the crust are simply too great.
2) There are long chains of submarine volcanoes that intersected the Hawaiian chain—some at large angles. It is now recognized that if hotspots exist, they must move.
3) Other volcanic chains, such as the Bermuda Rise, are almost perpendicular to the claimed movements of their plates.
4) If the mantle circulates enough to move a plate, why is a hotspot’s plume in that moving mantle fixed?
5) If a chain of volcanoes means its plate is drifting, does an isolated volcano mean that its plate is not drifting?
6) Faster moving plates should have fewer volcanic cones “burned” through them than slower plates. Just the opposite is the case.
7) The chemistry of rocks comprising these “hotspot” chains indicates that the magma originated from the upper mantle, not the lower mantle boundary as claimed by plate tectonics.
8) Other island chains show no correlation between age dates of rocks along the progression of the chain.
9) The hot spot theory doesn’t stand up to scrutiny: “It seems that we must abandon the convenient concept of fixed hotspots as reference points for past plate motions.” Ulrich Christensen, “Fixed Hotspots Gone with the Wind,” Nature, Vol. 391, 19 February 1998, p. 740.

Mantle Circulation is also not backed by facts.
1) Japanese research as far back as 1988 showed that magma has a cross-over depth of about 200 miles. Meaning, at that depth, the magma's volume is reduced by about 50 percent and it becomes so dense that it can only sink, not rise. Below 200 miles, magma sinks, never to rise again. Magma can't possibly be coming up from the mantle.
2) “A simple calculation shows that if ascent is governed by Stoke’s law, then the great viscosity of the lithosphere (about 1025 poise, if it is viscous at all) ensures that the ascent velocity will be about ten thousand times smaller than that necessary to prevent solidification. A successful ascent could be made only by unrealistically large bodies of magma.” Bruce D. Marsh, “Island-Arc Volcanism,” Earth’s History, Structure and Materials, editor Brian J. Skinner (Los Altos, California: William Kaufman, Inc., 1980), p. 108
3) Check out the book by N. Christian Smoot, "Tectonic Globaloney" where he catalogs the problems with Plate Tectonics. He mapped the sea floor for 30 years and says the evidence does not support PT.
4) Calculations are sometimes put forth in an attempt to show that plumes can rise through the mantle. Usually assumed are unrealistically low values for the mantle’s viscosity and density or unrealistically high values for the plume’s initial temperature and volume. These claims take the position, “We know flood basalts came from the outer core, so here is how it must have happened.” Other calculations show that a magma plume rising buoyantly and melting its way up from the core-mantle boundary would initially have to exceed the earth’s volume for just one drop of magma to reach the earth’s surface.

Magnetic Stripes:
1) A better explanation of the magnetic stripes on the ocean floor isn't reversal, it is varying intensity. More or less magnetism. There is no possible mechanism for reversal of earth's magnetic field. Does the core suddenly stop and then start to spin the other way? (dynamo theory) What happens in the middle-- does earth have NO magnetic field for a short time?
2) In his book, Smoot documents the fact that the magnetic striping pattern on the ocean floor is overwhelmingly NOT lined up with plate boundaries,
Ok what would cause a tectonic plate to suddenly change direction?

I lived in Mililani and Wahiawa on Oahu. This is a great explanation of what we've studied over there for the past two decades. The only issue I have with it is the explanation of the flood basalts in Siberia and India. There's strong evidence of massive volcanic activity independent of the movement of the Pacific Plate causing those. There's also the North American, Filipino/Philippine Sea, and Australian plates separating the Pacific plate from the Eurasian and Indian plates.

Probably worth noting that massive eruptions that are associated with mass extinctions did not cause the extinctions due to a massive explosion, but rather the climatic/oceanic chemistry changes associated with the unimaginably large volume of ash and gas.

It is linked to the water currents that are driven by electric currents in the ocean called telluric currents. It is not the hypothesized borders between tectonic plates that causes the geological activity. It is in the shallow and coastal water that instabilities called double layers form along these telluric currents. These instabilities are sensitive to changes in the electric currents. Such changes can lead to explosion.
Double layers are two layers of charge. One of the layers has a net positive charge and one of them has a net negative charge. They form boundaries between most conductive media of different thermodynamic properties. There is a voltage drop across the double layers. For the double layers to maintain stability they require electric currents to circulate them.

When the current passes trough Hawaii there is a sudden change properties of the conductive media. So Hawaii should be surrounded by a double layers forming a circle around the island.
Inside the crust you can find that the current can loop around the double layers by going under it. Some of the currents will also penetrated the top of the island. When this current gets strong it will cause magma to stream up to the surface.
When these double layers explode it will result in a volcanic eruption.

Another scenario is When the double layers exist to form a border that doesn't encircle an island. But instead form a boundary along the coastal lines of continent. Then you will find that that the exploding double layers causing earth quakes.

We where taught tectonics in 5th grade.....Simply put...Plate enters the subduction zone (the junction between the  two tectonic  plates, AKA the east side of the ring of fire aka California, Washington, Alaska, and Oregon)) zone traverses back to the core melts down, then it is forced back up to the crust, where it releases the newly made crust in the form of magma....... Hawaii is just a big ole fissure where the crust is weak and part of the lava is redirected there much like water when it traverses the path of least resistance. Molten anything does not have a magnetic charge, if that was the case the magma would travel a northerly or southerly direction (dependent on what polarity it was) towards lets say the west point of alaska, or south towards the Gulf of California and beyond. Since gravity influences everything it would also influence the magma, and it  would travel the path of least resistance (again like water) that would be south. Just saying.

This is all correct, however, there are problems with this explanation. The Helium 3 and Helium 6, for instance, didn't match what we expected from MPT. They actually found these elements at levels that match levels found in asteroids, not planetary core.

Point of correction to the video:
Observing the rates today does not equal the rates of plume formation in the past. For example, the evidence that the Pacific Plate once move faster over the hot spot is how small the mountains are under the water that form Emperor's Chain from Hawaii to the Asian Plate.

The uniformitarian theory has a serious flaw in presuming no catastrophic events, and presuming the rates of things today are constant rates of a millennia ago, therefore, hundreds of millions of years ago.

Asserting that the rates observed today equals the rates of things theoughtout the past is a Bad hypothesis, and results bad conclusions to get to an old anything.

Hey physics girl, there are some problems with this theory... the crossover depth of magma is 220 miles deep. Magma below 220 miles will compress and sink!

The so called "magnetic reversals" are not actually reversals at all. They are points of varying magnetic intensity. An arbitrary line has been drawn through the data, it is then assumed that the measurements below this line indicate magnetic south while points above indicate magnetic north.

Further problems arise when you consider plate tectonics in general... we are all taught that this theory is correct, but when the details are examined the theory fails miserably. Subduction does not occur! What force broke the earths crust into plates? What force moves one plate under another? Is this imaginary force pulling the plates or pushing them? Why are there gravity deficiencies found above ocean trenches? What is responsible for the arc and cusp pattern found around the ring of fire?

I suggest you thoroughly study the hydroplate theory.
